results.firPara: • Mkhitaryan to miss at least two matches with ankle injury
results.secPara: José Mourinho says Wayne Rooney is not guaranteed to replace the injured Henrikh Mkhitaryan. The Armenian is expected to miss at least two matches with an ankle injury he sustained when tackled by Danny Rose in the 1-0 defeat of Tottenham  on Sunday.
results.webTitle: Wayne Rooney not guaranteed to replace Mkhitaryan, says José Mourinho

results.firPara: Students criticise document saying female players might be encouraged by stamps and nice-smelling bibs as absolute rubbish
results.secPara: Students criticise document saying female players might be encouraged by stamps and nice-smelling bibs as absolute rubbish
results.webTitle: Schoolgirls say FA paper on football treats them like 'brainless baby Barbies'

results.firPara: Cesare Prandelli is just the latest manager to discover the club with the fourth biggest La Liga budget is fomenting in a culture creating conditions for failure
results.secPara: Im going to speak slowly, so I hope you can understand me, Cesare Prandelli said and they understood him, all right. Valencias manager addressed them in Italian as usual and there was no translation. Not yet, anyway. That was usual too; there never is. He called the shirt a maglia, not a camiseta, and the promise to go slow didnt last long, but he tugged at his top as he did so and they knew what he was saying, more or less something about sweating for it, fighting for it, loving it. And if not, fuori!. Which was close enough to Fuera! for everyone to get it and, just in case, he gestured towards the door. Fuori! Fuori! Fuori!. Out! Out! Out!
results.webTitle: Loving the shirt is not enough, Valencia are sinking in a mess of their own making | Sid Lowe

results.firPara: Today Big Cup tombola, Gary Nevilles No1 fan and Terrible Things That Happened In 2016

results.webTitle: Something has clearly gone awry in Uefa’s cruel masterplan

results.firPara: Ronald Koeman has described Evertons run of one win in 10 Premier League matches as unavoidable proof that he and his players are under-performing.
results.secPara: Everton, who host Arsenal on Tuesday, are on a dismal run of form that also includes defeat by the Championship club Norwich City in the EFL Cup. Defeat at Watford on Saturday was Evertons fifth in the last six away games, prompting Koeman to admit his team struggle against physical opposition, and criticism is mounting among supporters at the return under a manager hired on a £6m per annum contract in the summer.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman: ‘Everybody at Everton is under-performing, including me’

results.firPara: There are, inevitably, mixed feelings about seeing past chairmen and directors of the Football Association speaking out now about the need to curb the Premier Leagues power, given their propensity mostly to do nothing about it when they had the chance, in the actual job. That might be unfair to David Triesman, who was savaged by the Premier League during his unhappy stint as chairman for daring to assert the primacy of the FA, but the reform proposals of David Bernstein and Greg Dyke, which they failed to secure, always seemed aimed more at the FA itself, and in office they were not noted critics of the Premier League.
results.secPara: Dyke, characteristically vocal now, famously told the Guardian in an interview while he was the chairman of footballs still-distinguished and historic governing body, that he had so much money personally, he didnt give a fuck. Yet rather than revel in that personal financial independence by taking on the billionaire vested interests of the Premier League for the games greater all-round good, Dyke somehow ended up implementing a redundancy programme at the FA itself, sacking 100 people, some of whom are still not in work a year on – so presumably still have to give a fuck.
results.webTitle: Reform call will mean sweet FA unless Premier League excesses are curbed

results.firPara: Five former executives have blamed the Football Associations elderly white men for blocking reform. Its not the first time this demographic has taken flak recently

results.firPara: Manchester United will play the French side Saint-Étienne in the last 32 of the Europa League.
results.secPara: United qualified as Group A runners-up and were paired with Christophe Galtiers team, who defeated Anderlecht in their final Group C game to pip the Belgian club to top spot.
results.webTitle: Manchester United drawn against Saint-Étienne in Europa League last 32

results.firPara: Manchester United and Tottenham will play St Etienne and Gent respectively in the last 32 of the Europa League
results.secPara: The draw is over and the English sides will be confident of progressing. Manchester United have Saint Etienne, who have a certain Florentin Pogba on their books. Hes someones brother. The French side are eighth in Ligue 1, while Tottenham face Gent, who are fifth in the Belgian league. The ties will be played on 16 and 23 Feburary. Thats all from me today. Thanks for reading. Bye!
results.webTitle: Europa League last 32 draw: Manchester United face St Etienne – as it happened
